events.title: TNR
events.details: Come join your bike family for a social ride around Portland. We will have a store stop, park stop and be ending by the river! We will Stay together in a group taking over the streets. Stay behind the ride leader, look out for each other and watch out for agro drivers! #WEARETNR
events.printdescr: Come join your bike family for a social ride around Portland. We will have a store stop, park stop and be ending by the

events.title: Northwest in Motion (NWIM) Ride
events.details: Join BikeLoudPDX and community advocates on a tour of NW greenways as we gear up for Council adoption of the Northwest in Motion Plan. We will highlight several of the safety projects included in the plan to help make NW greenways more friendly to all ages and abilities, as well as take a quick detour to see Portland’s first protected intersection! We will end at Paymaster Lounge at NW 17th and Marshall. Relatively easy pace and minor elevation gain, but a few short sections sharing the road on higher traffic streets.

events.title: Corvidae Bike Club Ride
events.address: N Albina Ave and Ainsworth St
events.details:
We aim to promote bike safety and accessibility, and to inspire biking as a alternative to fossil fueled travel within Portland. Let's have some fun while were at it! 

Come join us for a 2nd Sunday Funday ride every month. We meet at the Rose Fountain at the center of the Peninsula Park Rose Garden at 2PM. We roll out at 2:30. This will be a social-paced mystery ride. We generally make a couple park or supply stops. Each ride is lead by a different CORVIDAE member, and therefore will be unique. NOT A LOOP. This is a safe environment for all. Please check our FB page to review the CORVIDAE Code of Conduct as well as detailed descriptions of each ride. Ca-CAWW!
events.printdescr: We aim to promote bike safety and accessibility, and to inspire biking as a alternative to fossil fueled travel!

events.title: Foster Night Ride
events.details:
Come meet your friends, family and neighbors and get some food by the fire, before the ride. Come prepared for anything, be kind to all travelers, pack out what you bring in, have the ride of your life. 
Guess ride leaders are encouraged, ask your ride leader. We are focused mainly on south east Portland but we ride everywhere.
events.timedetails: Meet up at 6:30pm ride out at 7:30pm
events.printdescr: Meet up at fopo food carts at 6:30 pm ride out at 7:30pm

events.title: Shift Board Meeting
events.address: 1155 SW Morrison St, Portland, OR 97205, USA
events.details: Come see how Shift is run! Volunteer to help out or just hello. NOT A RIDE!
events.printdescr: Come see how Shift is run! Volunteer to help out or just hello. NOT A RIDE!

events.printdescr: Come join your bike family for a social ride around Portland. We will have a store stop, park stop and be ending by the

events.title: Chehalem Range Ramble
events.address: Will be off MAX in Hillsboro.
events.details:
It’s time to return to The Mountain, Chehalem that is. The Chehalem Mountain Range is a small but relatively steep range dividing the Tualatin and Yamhill Valleys just southwest of Hillsboro. This area is relatively unknown to folks around the Portland metro area, but features some nice and quiet roads plus a fair share of gravel!

This 45 mile ride is not super-intense, but isn’t easy. You will be rewarded with nice countryside and beautiful vistas. The ride is a no-drop ride, and won’t be moving fast. (i.e. your leader does not move fast). Expect several regroups. If you like riding hard and fast, this may not be the ride for you, but if you can ratchet back the intensity you may just enjoy yourself!

Registration is required, and is free. When you register you'll get more details, including exact start location.
events.printdescr: why are we doing this again?

events.title: Linkin Park to Park: A Bike Party
events.organizer: brent hammer, teenage dirtbag bike club
events.details:
The Teenage Dirtbag Bike Club says: Beware the ides of March! And beware the rides of March!

A ride set to the music of the famed Linkin Park and their my metal brethren.

Join us at Grant park for a slow pace, park jumping ride ending at Lincoln Park in SE!

The ride ends with us pouring one out for Chester!

Rip baby boy!
events.printdescr: The Teenage Dirtbag Bike Club says: Beware the ides of March!  Linkin Park Themes Toga Party
